about

Hey there! I'm sure you've gathered by now my name is Rudolph Schmitz. Or you hadn't and now you have! Alternatively, you can call me Rudy. Whichever is easiest for you to remember. One is a famous reindeer's name, the other is a widely known movie about a football player. Both unique enough to keep track of. For those curious, no, I still haven't seen the movie Rudy. Besides having the ability to write short paragrahs about my name, I've also obtained the following credentials:

- Graduated in 2011 with my B.S. in electrical engineering with a 3.13 GPA from Missouri University of Science and Technology (formally University of Missouri - Rolla)

- Graduated in 2012 with my M.S. in engineering management with a 4.0 GPA from Missouri University of Science and Technology (formally University of Missouri - Rolla)

- Worked for over 3 years for Intelligrated/Honeywell as a commissioning engineer performing controls engineering work. Over there, I programmed PLCs using what's called "ladder logic", which is essentially the same as any other programming language, just more visualized. In addition I designed electrical controls systems. I even lead several projects valued at over $1M! Which is pretty neat. What does that mean though? The quickest and most apt description I can think of is: You know how Amazon takes all your orders, sorts the packages, bundles them up and ships them out to you? I was responsible for the electrical and programmatic systems behind you receving your products. Please note I didn't only work on Amazon projects; this is just an example.

- I'm proficient with HTML, CSS, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP and VBA. I'm highly motivated to keep up my self-education regarding all the aforementioned languages and more!

- I'm proficient with Git, Github and Bitbucket for proper revision control.

- I've lived for 29 years -- my best streak so far!

name: data collector


languages: VBA


tools: Microsoft Excel VBA



I'm a pretty big nerd and to demonstrate that... I present to you my VBA project that I wrote to help my World of Warcraft guild more easily recruit players. Yeah. Link to the code on GitHub is at the bottom. Here's a short description, though:




1. Open Microsoft Excel and click the Import Players button.


2. A dialogue box will open prompting you to enter a server name (think of this like a job seeker's city/state location).


3. A dialogue box will open asking how many pages you wish to run. These pages correspond to the number of tables on the website wowprogress.com. In short, the more pages you enter, the more players that will be scanned for the server you entered in step #2.



4. The tool will begin running after you hit ok. Behind the scenes, the tool is pulling each table down in to its own sheet and filtering each sheet with the server name specified in step #2. Once all tables (sheets) are populated and sorted, the tool takes all of the resulting information and combines the information into a tab called, "Combined" and deletes all the individual sheets. If you entered 25 pages, then 25 sheets were temporarily created, filtered and aggregated to the "Combined" tab, then subsequently deleted.





5. Don't forget to check out the code below! Try the tool for yourself!



https://github.com/rwschmitz/importPlayers
